planetsData.name: Mercury
planetsData.description: The smallest and closest planet to the Sun. Its surface is filled with craters and is very hot during the day but very cold at night.

funFacts.fact: It is the fastest planet, completing one orbit in 88 Earth days
It has a cratered surface like the moon
Surface temperatures can vary drastically: -180°C to 430°C in a single day
It has no atmosphere at all
A day on Mercury is equivalent to 59 Earth days

planetsData.name: Venus
planetsData.description: The hottest planet in the solar system due to the extreme greenhouse effect. Often called Earth's “sister” planet due to its similar size.

funFacts.fact: Rotates counterclockwise (retrograde)
The hottest planet in the Solar System, although not the closest to the Sun
Its atmospheric pressure is 90 times that of Earth
Named after the Roman goddess of love
Can be seen from Earth without a telescope

planetsData.name: Earth
planetsData.description: Our planet! The only planet known to have life. It has a perfect atmosphere and water in liquid form.

funFacts.fact: The only planet known to have life
71% of its surface is covered in water
Has an atmosphere that protects it from harmful radiation
Rotates at a 23.5 degree tilt, causing seasons
Has 1 natural moon with the closest distance to the parent planet

planetsData.name: Mars
planetsData.description: The red planet that is the target of human exploration. It has the highest mountains and deepest canyons in the solar system.

funFacts.fact: Called the Red Planet because it contains iron oxide on its surface
Has the highest mountain in the Solar System (Mount Olympus Mons)
Has 2 small moons: Phobos and Deimos
Once had liquid water on its surface
A day on Mars is similar to a day on Earth (24 hours 37 minutes)

planetsData.name: Jupiter
planetsData.description: The largest planet in the solar system. Has the Great Red Spot, a storm that has been going on for hundreds of years.

funFacts.fact: The largest planet in the Solar System
Has the Great Red Spot, a giant storm that has lasted for hundreds of years
Has 95 identified moons
Has thin, barely visible rings
Jupiter's mass is 2.5 times the mass of all the other planets in the Solar System combined

planetsData.name: Saturn
planetsData.description: Famous for its beautiful rings made of ice and rock. It has a very low density and can float on water.

funFacts.fact: The only planet with rings visible from Earth
It is lighter than water
It has 146 identified moons
Its largest moon, Titan, has a thick atmosphere
A year on Saturn is equal to 29.5 Earth years

planetsData.name: Uranus
planetsData.description: A “reclining” planet due to the extreme tilt of its axis (98 degrees). It has a blue-green color due to methane in its atmosphere.

funFacts.fact: Rotates at a 98-degree angle, as if 'rolling' around the sun
Blue-green in color due to methane
Has a thin ring
Named after the Greek god of the sky
Only one mission has ever come close to the planet (Voyager 2 in 1986)

planetsData.name: Neptune
planetsData.description: The farthest planet from the Sun. It has the strongest winds in the solar system with speeds of up to 2,100 km/h.

funFacts.fact: Coldest planet in the Solar System
Has the fastest winds in the Solar System (reaching 2,100 km/h)
The Great Dark Spot is similar to the Great Red Spot on Jupiter
One year on Neptune is equivalent to 165 Earth years
Dark blue color due to methane content
